flawed_nl_solution:
Kate bought 7 packs × 18 balls/pack = <<7*18=162>>162 red bouncy balls.
She also bought 6 packs × 18 balls/pack = <<6*18=108>>108 yellow bouncy balls.
Kate bought 162 balls - 108 balls= <<162-108=54>>54 more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls.
#### 54

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 126, not 162. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
